author: Oswin
title: My dad
body: My dad had a fall in December and was taken to Doncaster (dri) from the moment we got there he had the best drs and nurses there he was then taken to ward 1/3 where he had a hip operation the staff were absolutely amazing even down to the domestics my dad has server dementia I cant thank them enough for all they did for him. From the bottom of my heart thank you dri xxx

readBy.name: Doncaster and Bassetlaw Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: 7 month old daughter
body:
Called 111 about my daughter turning purple and having a high temp. With in minutes I was on a FaceTime with a paramedic who looked at my daughter colouring and to see how she was it was such a great way of dealing with something calmed me down and he talked me through what would happen now.

5 minutes later a car arrived next to our drive a young paramedic had heard the situation and knew it would be hours for an ambulance so he came with all the equipment in his own car and started taking her vitals I couldn’t thank this young man enough I wish I could remember his name ! 

Half an hour later the ambulance arrived because this man had told them to meet him at our home they swaped over and they were brilliant as well all of them were great with my daughter and my family. When we arrived at glouster hospital they apologised for a wait that might of happend but luckily we were seen with in the hour.

We would be lost with out the ambulance service and I think the FaceTime is a brilliant thing to do to asses what’s happening because stressed people tend to miss things or not get there words out and to the young man who took it upon his self to come to us Thank you there needs to be more people like you !

readBy.name: South Western Ambulance Service NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great consultation and time management
body: Very nice and helpful GP! She has answered all my questions, helped with some doubts. Very positive and structured consultation. I received all my documents and comments/references straight after which was very handy. Also I'm really happy with the NHS virtually app - enjoy it so much and will recommend my friends:) really helping me with my time management!

author: Jess0411
title: Kind and professional support at home
body:
I was taken to the A & E department recently after coming round lying on the floor and having no idea of what had happened or how I got there. My only recollection was of getting dressed at about 8:00am, and it appears I was preparing to walk the dog as she was wandering around with her coat on. A neighbour came to my door at about 11:30am as I had been missed at coffee that morning, and I managed to crawl and answer the door. She said that I was very confused and that I thought I was in the USA with my son, attending my daughter’s wedding - she lives in the US and has been married for over 20 years.  
The neighbour called my son and he contacted my GP surgery who advised him I should be taken to hospital. After having tests, x-rays and a scan, the diagnosis was a severe chest infection and I was told I would be allowed home, but, as I live alone the Dundee Enhanced Support Acute Team (DECS-A) would come in and take over my care. I was happy with this, alhough I had never heard of this team before.  
A nurse and doctor arrived the following morning and they were very kind and explained that they would take over my medical care until they were happy that I was fully fit again. The nurse arranged to collect my prescription and she brought it back for me that afternoon and she came in every day until my antibiotics were finished and she was happy I was fully recovered.  
I can never thank that team enough for what they did for me. I hadn’t even realised I was unwell and they just stepped in and helped me. A service like that, provided by such a professional team of medically qualified people, is worth it’s weight in gold, and must surely mean that people, who would otherwise have to stay in hospital, may be able to be cared for at home, and that’s where most of us would rather be.

author: LizTr76
title: My son's excellent care in hospital and at our local GP practice
body:
My son fell ill with flu in December 2022. After 6 days he was still very, very unwell. Our GP surgery (Linlithgow Group Medical Practice) amazingly saw him 3 days in a row (from day 6 of his illness) and started him speculatively on antibiotics even though they weren’t entirely sure what was wrong. On day 3 of visiting the GP, the doctor recognised that he had cellulitis in his eye socket and arranged for us to go to hospital as it can be very serious.  
At St John’s children’s ward (where we stayed overnight) we were treated so well. They were clearly busy but they were attentive and explained clearly what was needed. My son was also given some gorgeous Christmas gift toys to cheer him up which was so kind. The nurses also looked after me as I tried to calmly support him. He is a shy child but they made him feel comfortable enough to answer questions and he was able to sleep well for the first time in days.  
Thankfully because our GPs caught hi illness quickly and because of the prompt admission to St John’s and the care he received there, we only had to stay 24 hours in hospital. We are so grateful for all the care he received.He is rarely unwell and it was quite overwhelming but we were kindly looked after. Thankfully he’s made a full recovery.

author: zebracz58
title: No confidence in A & E department
body:
Came to A&E with suspected Heart Attack, waited approximately 20mins for an ECG, had one earlier by a Paramedics. They took bloods, put in a cannula and I was told to wait for a doctor to call me. I sat back down in the waiting area and the tannoy kept saying the waiting time was around 1 hour 30mins.  
Four hours later checked my blood sugars (Insulin Dependent Diabetic) reading was low and dropping. My husband requested a glucose gel, but as I was throwing up they replied there would be no point and to leave it with them. This was at 18:22. At 18:55 they checked my sugars on one of their machines, did not clean finger before checking. The reading was not classed as low so I was sent back to waiting area. Asked when I would see a doctor and was told I had been transferred to a medical doctor so they work the wards as well as A&E so no time could be given.  
Feeling very nervous and generally ill, body beginning to shake due to my low sugar levels. I have no confidence in the department or the staff. Not sure what to do next or who to turn to.

author: crickethp67
title: Keep up the good work
body:
I had my colonoscopy at D&G today and was treated with so much respect .  
I was told what they were doing every step of the way and was told to let them know if I was in to much pain or I wanted them to stop .  
The lovely nurse was rubbing my arm all the way through the procedure.  
When it was over the doctor explained what he had done and seen  
I was taken to recovery and given tea and biscuits and a nurse came and explained everything to me again showing pictures and explained a copy will go to my GP and biopsy’s results are 4-6 weeks.  
Can’t thank them enough for there great care and respect  
Keep up the good work your one in a million  
[Unsure about 'Being listened to']  
  
[Unsure about 'Explanations']  
  
[Unsure about 'Other staff']

author: cuberj93
title: Compassionate and helpful staff
body: My premature daughter has been in and out of RHCYP with a reoccurring infection. She recently was in with suspected sepsis. The staff in A&E and Castle Mey ward are absolutely outstanding and they saved my daughters life. They are so compassionate, helpful and went above and beyond with their care for my daughter! I will forever be grateful to them!

title: Deeply unhelpful
body: I waited three months for an appointment only to be told by a very unempathetic mental health worker that I could not access their therapy services because my mental health issues were too severe. No alternatives were offered. I left the place crying.

title: Outstanding
body: I can’t rate and recommend this surgery enough! Everyone is wonderful! The receptionists are patient and kind and all the medical staff are very attentive and professional. I have had outstanding care from everyone I have seen and I am extremely grateful.

title: Exceptionally helpful and supportive
body: I wanted to say how much I appreciate the support that the gps have provided to me and my family over the last couple of weeks. My 89 year old mother has been seriously ill with flu which triggered severe asthmatic reaction. We only managed to avoid her going into hospital (which would be a distressing and disorientating experience because of her dementia) because of the care and advice we received from the gps. They have been on hand throughout this time regularly on the phone and visiting my mum at home at a time when the practice and nhs services generally have been considerably stretched and under pressure. My mum is beginning to recover and that is due to the doctors guidance and intervention. I feel so thankful for their help at this stressful time.

author: orangehq89
title: My sister
body:
Sadly our sister passed away at the start of January 2023 aged 60 years at Forth Valley Royal Hospital, Larbert. My sister and I would just like to thank all the staff at ward B31 for all the love, kindness, compassion and dedication shown by all the staff.  
Forth Valley Royal Hospital seems to get some really bad press sometimes. You just have to be there to see how special they really are thank you so much for everything.  
Lots of love

title: Great Hospital
body: I was in day surgery and would like to thank every member of staff for the good care they all took of me today I was very impressed both times I’ve attended Salford Royal Would certainly recommend your hospital to friends So my thanks to everyone on duty today

readBy.name: Salford Royal NHS Foundation Trust (Renal AQuA)

author: Wigston Woman
title: No help. No hope.
body:
The Community Team Nurse I spoke to should not be taking calls from people who are ill. They had no compassion or empathy. In fact the opposite.  
If I ask for help I’m told to phone 111.  
If I phone 111 I’m assessed by the crisis team that the community team won’t refer me too.  
I’m desperate but told to phone 999 if I can’t keep myself safe  
Then I’m told if the police attend-which I tell them will happen, it’s a waste of police resources.  
No help. No hope.

title: Amazing A and E staff
body: My son was brought in by ambulance ,very unwell ,passed out in waiting room ,staff were there within seconds ,despite waiting for hours in a corridor the A and E staff were fantastic, gave him lots of medication repeatedly, they were all lovely and although the corridors were full up with people they gave him what they could and cared for not only my son but also everyone else ,they are on their knees but still did everything they could ,can't fault them ,brilliant ,thankyou so much all of you x

readBy.name: Royal Surrey County Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Exemplary practice
body: I had general surgery for an upper gastrointestinal hernia at the Esher Wing & from the start to the recovery unit everyone was attentive, professional & reassuringly calming. Outstanding

author: Patient Carer
title: Frustration trying to contact GP surgery
body:
I have made numerous calls to my surgery, unable to get through, all appointments taken etc. When you go into the surgery they say can't help we have to call .  
Yet again I have gone into surgery as a prescription was not fulfilled, only to be told I have to ring in on behalf of wife (I am her carer ), to get an appointment. She suffers with blackouts and anxiety issues along with palpitations that can cause blackouts. I asked for Diazepam. She has already had these in past but she tries not to take them unless really necessary. The last prescription was May of 2022, so you can see how long she tries to not take them and how long they would last. Again and again we tried to get through but never can.  
I asked for an appointment with practice manager only to be ignored. No reply to letters. I am at my wits end and am seething right now.

title: Small
body: Good practice very friendly staff approachable and comforting Good practice very friendly staff approachable and comforting Good practice very friendly staff approachable and comforting

author: attendanttx96
title: Positive experience in gynaecology
body:
I had to attend the Grace Gynae clinic today, I was very nervous about this, however Specialist Nurse Katie made me feel very normal and comfortable. I can't thank her enough for making my appointment embarrassment free and comfortable. She is an amazing nurse.  
The Grace clinic is so important for a lot of woman and can be very embarrassing and uncomfortable. Also everything was explained very well and I went home understanding my heath issues a lot better.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Small
body: Good practice very friendly staff approachable and comforting Good practice very friendly staff approachable and comforting Good practice very friendly staff approachable and comforting

title: Amazing practice
body: I couldn't be happier with this surgery. Everyone is always smiling and polite. The doctor is extra safe and I feel that our family's health is in good hands.

author: January2023
title: Kind and reassuring service
body:
My young daughter had a potential UTI and was symptomatic of same. I was unsure about ringing the out of hours GP as I know it wouldn’t be classed as a medical emergency and am very aware of how stretched and under pressure our amazing health care staff are.  
The lady/receptionist who was on triage could not have been lovelier or more empathetic and reassuring which was a great relief.  
I received a call back from a male doctor (I can’t remember his name) about 2 hrs later who was just fantastic. Not only was I reassured that I did the right thing by ringing but he stressed that if I had any further concerns over the weekend before my own surgery opens again, to not hesitate in ringing.  
The kind and reassuring nature of both staff was much appreciated during the ongoing NHS crisis - thank you both so much from a worried mum!

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

author: AWESOMEANNIE
title: 5* treatment by breast team
body:
Just a note of thanks and appreciation for the 5* treatment from nurses Sharon, Amy, Susan and Yvonne on my admission for my surgery at Wishaw Hospital Day Surgery Unit. The care and professionalism shown was second to none.  
Dr Sarah and her team are amazing and pre operation my lovely anaesthetist Claire and her colleagues put me at ease for which I was very grateful.  
Cannot praise the service enough. Thanks to all of you.

author: BHMM201017
title: A quick and thorough A&E visit!
body:
My daughter attended A&E in RHCYP on Wednesday where she had a throat swab taken. I called the department yesterday for results and the phone was answered by one of the doctors, Paul. He explained he couldn’t find her results but would phone me back after he looked further. Paul phoned me back 15 minutes later to apologise that he couldn’t find my daughters results but asked how she was feeling now. I explained that she hadn’t improved but that she had not deteriorated. He asked if I’d be happy to bring her back to the department as he would rather she be checked over to see whether or not antibiotics would be needed to help her and I agreed so got ready to take her through.  
When we arrived we checked in at reception and were triaged within 10 minutes by two lovely nurses who chatted away to my daughter to make her feel at ease and then took us through to a cubicle. Within 20 minutes of being in the cubicle, Donna, the nurse practitioner came to examine my daughter. She asked for a background of what had been going on and listened into her chest. Donna then explained what she found and recommended we try an inhaler to see if it improves my daughters chest and that once it had been given Donna would come back to check if it had helped.  
Beth, one of the nurses then came to give the inhaler and, again, she was so lovely to my daughter who wasn’t impressed with the spacer! Donna then came back and informed me that the inhaler had really helped to clear up my daughters chest so recommended we go home with an inhaler and antibiotics. We have been in and out of St Johns A&E for the same reasons since my daughter was 9 weeks old and she is now 2. This is the first we have attended RHCYP and the team were prompt and thorough and explained everything I needed to know in detail and continuously put my mind at ease. I’m aware that services are extremely stretched right now but it never once impacted the care we received. We were in and out of A&E within 2 hours, including waiting on medication. Thank you to everyone for outstanding care.

author: Sauce1
title: Any one worried don’t be.
body:
Was very nervous before but the staff Senior Registrar (SR) Palmer and Janet were so friendly. SR Palmer was so easy to talk to, she explained everything what was going to happen during it.  
Both the nurses were lovely too during the whole visit. So any one worried don’t be.

title: Poorly run
body:
Would not recommend.

They did not attend an appointment in December, yet blamed me.

I then had a call booked to discuss this, which they did not attend,

author: Freeman
title: Wonderful care
body:
I just want to say a huge thank you for all the wonderful care you gave my son when he was admitted for an emergency operation for a ruptured appendix.  
He was in safe hands, and some nurses went the extra mile, and I as his Mum was grateful, as I could not be there.  
I hope you all get the rise you richly deserve.  
God bless you all, and thank you once again.

author: elephantjn38
title: The staff in this ward are a group of angels!
body:
I had an accident involving my car and was admitted to Causeway Hospital where I was given scans and then taken care of in Surgical 2.  
I was in over the Christmas period and just want to say that the staff in this ward are a group of angels!  
I was bed bound and having been an active independent person to being totally dependent on someone for toileting and washing etc it was hard to accept but I was soon put at ease and nothing was to much trouble.  
I was treated with respect and dignity throughout my stay. Everyone on the ward worked together as a team, helping each other out and ensuring all needs were catered for.  
The staff were ran off their feet but still kept smiling and caring... whether it be a cup of tea or medication and everything in between they were professional and attentive. It seemed to me that there was too heavy a workload for the one nurse in charge but they still managed to deliver an excellent level of care because that’s the type of people they are.  
I think it’s really sad that these people are having to strike for better pay and conditions and sometimes feel undervalued when they are doing their best in a broken system.  
I cannot recall all the names of auxiliaries and carers tending to me but I am so grateful to all of them… and to Ann and others who brought us tea and meals. Thanks especially to nurses Naomi, Aoife, Sheree and Mamsi for their care and attention.

readBy.name: Northern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Maggiemae
title: The service was excellent
body:
My Mastectomy was carried out by Ms Barker. She has such a lovely, caring manner about her and I immediately felt at ease and confident that I was in good hands for the procedure . She explained everything to me and never rushed me if I had anything to ask.  
Amanda her breast nurse was very knowledgeable too. When I went into the Day Surgery Unit everyone was so nice and organised which again made me feel comfortable as I was very anxious that morning.  
Moving on to after my operation and returned to the ward, my nurse Susan was very attentive and made sure I was comfortable and never rushed me to get up. The tea and sandwich ☕️🥪was so welcome as it had been 24 hours since I had eaten. Susan explained everything about getting home and the exercises I had to do.  
There has been a lot of bad press about the NHS recently and I can only say from my experience that from the time I went to see my GP till I walked out the door of the Day Surgery Unit the service was excellent.  
Thank you to everyone I came in contact with.

author: Jaspercat36
title: Hospital visiting concern
body:
i visited my husband in Aberdeen Royal Infirmary yesterday and felt totally safe with the standard of mask wearing and hand hygiene of all staff and visitors. At no point did visitors question the wearing of masks in the hospital setting.  
However today I had the delight of visiting my niece in the same hospital grounds after she had given birth to her son. The standard there was really shocking to me. There are signs stating the wearing of masks is required in the hospital setting but at no point did I see any visitor wearing one. The staff all had masks on and I did hear a member of staff asking someone to please wear a mask but they were met with rude comments.  
I certainly felt uncomfortable that at this point in the year when cases of covid and flu are on the rise that there are no stricter rules as we are all one hospital . Surely this should be addressed. Why are the rules different for one department to another in keeping the public safe in a medical setting?

author: Steam87
title: Care on Fielding Ward
body:
I was recently admitted to Musgrove Park Hospital after suffering from Ventricular Tachycardia. I spent just over a week in the hospital's Coronary Care Unit where the care I received there was sublime.  
I was then moved to Fielding Ward for a week to continue my care and recovery. I wasn't impressed at all here.  
To start with the ward is cramped with little space to move around on A bay. The shower and toilet room is dirty and needs a thorough clean. Sadly the ward was riddled with COVID-19 infections during my time there and there was no encouragement from nursing staff for patients to wear surgical face coverings to avoid spreading. Subsequently, infected patients were regularly coughing and spluttering without covering their mouths. Nursing staff also wore face coverings nonchalantly, many having their noses exposed and didn't wear gloves when handing equipment to patients. 2 out of 6 beds had hand sanitising bottles attached too. No wonder the infections spread like wildfire.  
Some, not all, nursing staff on this ward are very rude and disrespectful to patients. I witnessed the same nursing staff speak about patients in such a disrespectful and rude way to their colleagues, sometimes swearing and using hateful language. They would try to do this under their breath but doing this on the ward will, no doubt, be heard. I was shocked.  
Additionally, at mealtimes the same rude nursing staff would refuse to use the patient's name when speaking to them or about them to other colleagues and would refer to them as Bed A3 or Bed A6. I witnessed one nursing staff member order their colleague to ask bed 4 what they want for dessert, despite the fact that they were stood a meter away from the patient and could have politely asked them themselves. Awful. To me some of the HCA staff on Fielding Ward don't look like they want to be there. I saw some staff show very poor manners and approach to helping patients, particularly those who have complex needs.  
I was so glad when the time came for me to be transferred away up to Bristol Royal Infirmary and get away from this tired, dirty ward.

author: Unknown27
title: Long wait in A&E
body:
After not being able to see my own GP I was advised by an out of hours doctor to attend A&E so I made a visit to RVH. I got my bloods taken in A&E in the RVH at 19:30pm to check for a possible blood clot. I waited in the waiting room for 12 hours before moving to zone B in RVH around 07:45am the following day,only to find out my blood test had gone missing and i had been waiting 12 hours on results that were never coming.  
Thankfully the staff in zone B were very kind and couldn't have been more apologetic about losing my bloods. They redid my blood tests and organised for me to return to zone B the following day to get a scan and results of my new blood tests.  
I left exhausted and in more pain than when I initally came in due to sitting on the waiting room chairs and not able to elevate my already very swollen, painful and discoloured leg. This was a very unpleasant experience and just shows the immense pressure that is put on the nursing and medical staff within our emergency service.  
Something needs to be done to support the staff in order for patients like myself and those worse off to be treated and cared for properly.

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

author: Ageing fitness fanatic
title: An excellent service and a reassuring process.
body:
I have an impaired immune system, so when I tested positive for covid I phoned the NHS Lothian help line at 09:30 for possible prescription of antivirals. I gave my details to a helpful person who said that a pharmacist would phone me if I qualified. A pharmacist phoned me at 10:26, assessed my case, and talked me through the pros and cons very clearly. She told me which pharmacy would issue the antivirals and by lunchtime I had the drugs.  
An excellent service and a reassuring process.

author: anniedev
title: A poorly mum and an accident whilst in A&E
body:
I was in A&E with my mum who had been referred by her doctor for admission. We were informed that there was a 30 hour wait for a bed. My mum was poorly and in her late seventies - there was no way she could sit in a chair for 30 hours. I explained this to the receptionist and asked if we could wait for 8 of those 30 hours at home so at least she could lie down. The receptionist was so kind and asked the nurse in charge if they could find her a bed in minors, which she did. We were so grateful and my mum so needed to lie down. Pillows were like gold dust, but a lovely student nurse found us one to save my son a 50 mile round trip bringing one from home. I managed to find two blankets on a trolley so she was quite comfortable.  
Just as I was about to leave, I perched on an office chair. Because it was on wheels, it flew across the room behind me, I fell and whacked my head on a desk. I had a nasty head wound. A doctor must’ve heard the commotion because when I opened the door, he was there. He looked after me so well and 4 hours later was the one who stitched me up.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

author: Aitch
title: They were truly exceptional.
body: I was recently a patient at Ormskirk Hospital for a gynaecology appointment for an unpleasant and potentially painful procedure. The staff were wonderful, they held my hand, kept me informed of what was happening and literally guided me through the whole thing, I can’t thank them enough. They were truly exceptional.

readBy.name: Southport and Ormskirk Hospital NHS Trust

author: Topper
title: Reassured and well cared for
body:
I wanted to express my sincere thanks to the Nursing and Medical teams in AMIA (ward 101) and Ward 104.  
I was admitted as an emergency by my GP with a GI bleed and despite being anxious and worried I was left feeling reassured and well cared for.  
Despite the enormous pressures on both these wards, the teams were friendly and professional. Nothing was too much trouble.  
Both these areas had unrelenting stresses both for beds and resources. I thought the staff coped extremely well however it was upsetting to see the difficult working conditions for them.  
I witnessed medical and nursing staff going above and beyond and being absolutely stretched to the limit to ensure their patients were looked after.  
I fully support the Nursing staff with their industrial action as these skilled, highly experienced professionals deserve to be paid appropriately. The way that the staff dealt with the stress and strain of their working environment is admirable, but I would question how this level of activity can be maintained.  
I just wish the politicians could see the incredible work that the whole team do 24/7 at Aberdeen Royal Infirmary.  
Special thanks to Jill, Lesley and Margaret in AMIA and Dr English, Dr Thompson and their medical team, Sister Aileen and all her fantastic nursing team in Ward 104.  
[Unsure about 'Environment']  
  
[Unsure about 'Staff skills']

author: Niamhh1
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Sick of the food
body:
I have been in Lurgan hospital a few months. I first went over to the Royal in June then have been in Craigavon, back in the Royal for an operation, back in Craigavon and now Lurgan.  
The nurses are great. All of the nurses in all hospitals have really looked after me. My appetite at the minute isn’t good, as you can imagine I am absolutely sick of the food, I have been through the entire menu about 5 times now and I am just sick of looking at it.  
The cleaners keep my room really tidy. My time in Lurgan has been alright, it is what it is.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Mich12
title: Pleased and relieved with the outcome.
body:
We were seen today at East Lothian Community Hospital by the most efficient and charming doctor I have ever met. My elderly mum has been poorly for weeks but her breathing was poor so I contacted NHS24. I was then given an appointment and we were met by the doctor who introduced himself, shook hands, listened intently and reassured us. He took his time and we didn’t feel rushed and my mum looked better having spoken to him.  
He gave us a plan and prescriptions going over each medication I actually wish he was our family GP. I wanted to share this positive feedback given how hard it is at the moment for the NHS. Thankyou to all the staff from Nhs24 to clinician to head staff nurse to receptionist to GP. You have restored my faith and mum was so pleased and relieved with outcome.

author: Amanda23
title: Wonderful experience
body:
Wonderful experience of both the consultants and the nursing staff when I had a recent operation. Both the day shift and night shift nursing staff on the ward were so kind to me. I cannot thank them enough.  
I would also like to mention the very kind theatre staff who took my hand when I was on the operating table and the anaesthetists who talked to me. I would also like to mention my very kind surgeon.

author: Cousin22
title: They work as a well-oiled team, smiling through every shift
body:
All the staff in the ward and in the Palliative care team are dedicated to caring for patients and their relatives. They work as a well-oiled team and never let staff shortages affect the level of care delivered, smiling through every shift.  
Doctors, nurses, and all levels of care assistant support the care of patients with a high degree of commitment, which I have not noted in other areas of the hospital.  
In almost 6 weeks, including the difficult festive period, I never saw a variation in the real sense of team work and camaraderie, which was obvious every day. Staff could not do enough for my cousin, and her daughter who was staying over.

author: Davy Boy
title: Outstanding team effort
body:
I am in my sixties and I presented myself at Perth Royal Infirmary after having a heart attack the previous night.  
I was in ward 6 on Friday night into the early hours of Saturday morning  
I got extremely ill and was given a new start thanks to an outstanding team effort by the staff on duty to keep me alive!  
I would also like to thank the staff at the PRI for looking after my friend who died in the Macmillan hospice in September after receiving excellent nursing in the wards & a dignified death in peace in Macmillans hospice.  
Forever humbled & grateful. Kindest Regards

author: Anon985
title: Poor patient care
body: Nothing happened. I had a suspected broken rib but was told that they couldn't help me and I would need to go and wait for 7 hours in A&E.

readBy.name: Doncaster and Bassetlaw Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust
Sarah Champion's Office, MP for Rotherham

author: ospreykm46
title: Kindness and care on post natal ward
body:
I was reminded the other day of amazing care I received on the post-natal ward at Edinburgh Royal Infirmary in November 2021, by one person in particular - Lorna. I’m sorry I can’t remember her job title but she worked on ward 211 at the Simpson Maternity hospital.  
I unfortunately didn’t have a great experience with the doctors and midwives on the ward itself for various reasons which was extremely distressing, but Lorna really took care of me when I felt so low and so exhausted from everything that had happened to me and my daughter following a difficult birth.  
I had to stay on the ward for a few days after an emergency c-section and then phototherapy for jaundice, then had to be readmitted after being discharged.  
Lorna could tell that I was distressed and struggling and arranged for me to stay in a side room. She kept me company and fed my baby bottles while I expressed in the middle of the night, and she reassured me when I was worried about my baby. She brought me cups of tea and offered a kind ear to listen. I’ll always be grateful to Lorna for the kindness she showed me and my baby, she is one in a million.

author: Frances 52
title: My mums care F14 wythenshawe hospital
body:
My mum was admitted to hospital in December, previous to this I had been caring for her at home, she was bedridden with Alzeimer's and she’d suffered a stroke 20 months ago, sadly she died on ward F14 in January.  
Everyday I spent by her side and had one of the worse weeks of my life, while I sat with her at her bedside I witnessed neglect by staff, hardly any staff and no doctors. My mum was in severe discomfort but my cries for help were just ignored. I witnessed very little care, seeing patients asking for help, wanting the toilet but being ignored, call bells being ignored , staff saying I,ll come back shortly but often the patients wait a hour.  
Patients left in dirty sheets with no staff to change, one day I got there at 1030 am and the lady opposite said no one had been near mum since 6 am, after complaining, a quick 5 minute wash and change was given to the mum and the lady in the opposite bed who would watch over mum was moved to the other side of the ward and replaced with a very poorly lady who just seemed to be left for hours on end.  
So distressing for me to watch, my mum was up and down during her stay got better, got worse, different doctors giving different updates, it was very confusing and not doing the tests she needed earlier enough for 5 days.  
She had chronic constipation and looked in severe discomfort and uncomfortable, just a truly heartbreaking experience for me and sad for mum who got excellent care respect and treated with dignity at home from the lovely care package we had in place. Obviously she has now passed away which admittedly was always a possibility but I sincerely think her last couple of weeks were heartbreaking for me I would have liked to see more compassion and interest and not be ignored the times I sat there.  
Just to add it wasn't all bad, a couple of decent staff and a lovely coffee man who quite frankly brought a little cheer into those two horrific weeks, I spent Christmas Day Boxing Day by my mums side with no one hardly speaking to me the nurse did their jobs like robots, medication observations and many a time the health care staff, I saw some sat at reception playing on mobiles and eating crisps and chocolate biscuits, all this is fact and I have witnesses who sat with their families just as shocked so sad.

author: SDifolco
title: Concerns listened to
body:
Was let down by my GP surgery following a disappointing appointment with the mental health nurse, I felt they didn't listen to me and fobbed my concerns off as I was under addictions.  
My named nurse organised an appointment quickly for me with Addictions services and the doctor was amazing. He listened to every concern I had and started me on medication which I feel will help.

author: Kats50
title: So impressed by the care and attention of one nurse
body:
Visited my son in law and was so impressed by the care and attention Nichola was giving him. Above and beyond.  
He was very ill and in a confused state. Nichola spent so much time with him explaining why he was in hospital and eventually he understood. She encouraged him to relax and got him to take some fluids which he had been refusing to do  
Any questions we asked her about our son in law's care, she took time to explain to us in lay mans terms so we understood and told us about any procedures to be carried out.  
He was being a very difficult patient but with Nichola's attitude and caring manner we felt happy to leave him.  
This nurse Nichola deserves a medal she is an Angel in disguise  
Bless you Nichola you are the most caring person I have ever came across and NHS must be so proud to have you on their team

title: New patient- very impressed
body: Recently moved to the village and have gone from struggling to get repeat prescriptions filled on time to a brilliant surgery who sort out things in the time they say. Really friendly staff who I found very welcoming.

title: Pleasant efficiency
body:
Initial form to request an appointment which was completed by hand was presumably lost as there was no response. Telephoned the practice the following day and a receptionist completed another form over the phone. Within a few minutes I had an appointment with one of the GP’s. 
The receptionist was extremely helpful and polite.

title: Diabetic review
body: The lady I saw was friendly, helpful, kind, patient, thorough and understanding. I can’t fault the level of care received.

author: Flyingpenguin
title: The staff are all doing an excellent job
body:
I attended the Royal Hospital for Children at the QE on a Saturday evening at the start of January, I had two sick children with me, a three year old and a baby (the baby being the patient as his temperature was quite high). I was really worried about how long we were going to have to wait, as my three year old was scared to go in and desperate for his bed, however I had no other childcare options but to bring him as well.  
First of all I was really impressed with the waiting area in the A & E and that they had made it engaging and not frightening for small children, however we weren’t their long. We were triaged almost instantly, and then given a cubicle with a bed. Once we were there we were greeted by the nursing staff and then the doctor very quickly. I was very impressed at how professional, friendly and caring all of the staff that saw us were. I felt they were very thorough and thoughtful while looking after my baby, as well as being kind and supportive to my nervous older child, even offering him an ice lolly and a bed to rest on.  
I was only in a few hours for a swab and some observations for my little one, but I just wanted to say how positive an experience it was, when I had thought it would be otherwise. The staff are all doing an excellent job and I really appreciated all their hard work and kindness. Thank you.

title: Hospital stay for my son
body: The nurses and doctors in northbrook ward have been nothing amazing for my sons care. He was happy and comfortable with each and every single one of you and I couldn’t thank you anymore for the help and support you’ve given to us while he’s been unwell. Everything to the little chats throughout the day to make sure we’re both ok, to my sons care, to helping us in times of need, amazing. I’m so grateful to each and every single one of you. Thank you so much.

title: Wonderful service as always
body: Just wanted to leave a review to share what wonderful service my mum receives from this practice. Mum had run out of her medication late on Friday evening and I telephoned the surgery to ask for help. The receptionist was so kind and helpful and asked the doctor if he could provide a quick prescription. Within 1 hour I had been to the surgery, picked up the prescription and was home with mums medication. Absolutely quality all round. Excellent care and support especially in such difficult times. Thankyou very much.

title: Endoscopy
body: Had Endoscopy with throat spray, from start to finish I was treated with wonderful care and respect. Before procedure given excellent information, during procedure was comforted and talked to throughout.  On completion report was quickly available and looked after until report explained.  I’m 84 was grateful for the procedure and speed at being seen.

title: Lovely place
body: The nurse I spoke with was incredibly kind, gave me the exact kind of advice I needed and was very understanding of my situation

readBy.name: Central and North West London Mental Health NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent care
body:
I rang the surgery at 8.35 for an appt. After waiting a while in the queue I was give a face to face appt with a GP. 
GP assessed and thought I needed an appt with the asthma nurse, due to work commitments could not make the times so the nurse has been following me up via text messages.
Great use of technology to overcome problems and to improve healthcare.
Thank you

author: tucanaxn63
title: Excellent virtual visiting service
body:
Excellent service.  
Booking very straightforward and booking clerk very helpful.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Kind, supportive and friendly
body:
I've been registered at Manor surgery for ages and have always been happy with the practice, but it wasn't until I had a baby that I started to appreciate what a special place it is. From emergency calls about post birth complications, to ongoing wound care and discussions about my mental health, everyone I've met at Manor has been so kind and so 'human'. I see the same friendly faces and they remember me and my baby - the time taken to check in with me and ask how I was doing in those first bleak months made such a huge difference and I'm so grateful. I feel like the doctor, nurses, pharmacy and reception staff I've seen have time for me and genuinely listen when I explain what's going on. I don't have a lot of local support and without everyone at Manor Surgery I don't know what I would have done.
A lovely, friendly practice with warm, kind people!

title: Excellent Service
body: SpaMedica at Newcastle-under-Lyme have transformed my life in less than two hours.  I was shocked when my optician told me I needed a cataract operation as I thought I just needed stronger glasses but he referred me to SpaMedica and a month later I had my operation.  I was understandably very nervous but I can honestly say that I felt no pain during the short operation.  All the staff were so kind and quickly put me at ease.  My appointment was punctual and most of the time was spent sitting comfortably in the waiting room while the eye drops did their job.  The sight in my eye is amazing - I hadn't realised how bad it had become.  Thank you so much SpaMedica - you have made my life so much easier.

title: First class practice
body: My husband and I have only been with Northway Medical Centre for a short time, and can't praise them highly enough. The doctors we have dealt with, the receptionists, and nurses are all absolutely amazing. True professionalism, caring, and friendly.  This is a medical practice they should all be proud of. Thankyou all so much.

title: Very efficient
body: It was very easy to get through, and received a response within seconds! So would definitely recommend as it is way quicker than the phone

title: Extremely impressed
body: I came into the Conquest A&E early on Jan 1 with breathing difficulties. Spent a day in the Emergency treatment room, then admitted with flu. I've never seen such efficient dedication and care and attention to detail, an endlessly busy team of doctors and nurses dealing with dozens of walk-ins, so much patience and warmth and efficiency. I am seriously impressed and have no doubt they saved my life. No idea how these fantastic people cope with risking their own health at the same time showing such professionalism and kindness, and good humour, towards the rest of us. Really heartwarming. A huge thank you from me.

title: Excellent practice
body: I am happy about everyone which are working there , even the receptionists are very friendly, and about doctors I have to say a big Thank you for them patience and explanation

title: Excellent care
body: Had to attend a+e on New Year’s Day. Despite the current pressures on the nhs, I was seen promptly, all investigations were carried out and the appropriate treatment given. All staff were professional, caring and efficient. I arrived at 7am and was home for 12 midday. Thank you for you prompt care and the kindness shown by all.

readBy.name: University Hospitals of North Midlands NHS Trust

title: Always great service
body: Receptionist was really helpful and looked at couple of options for me, very clear and explained best possible options. Then sent text to confirm. Anytime I’ve attended the surgery the doctors and all staff have been professional and very thorough. Thanks to all.

title: Caring, compassionate and considerate!
body: The reception staff was welcoming and helpful. The doctor was extremely supportive and helpful, explained the condition very well and offered me a suitable solution and put me at ease as I was very anxious and feeling quite overwhelmed with my ongoing condition. I am very grateful for all her support in this time and day.

title: Excellent care.
body:
I had to attend A&E on a busy Friday night. I had a long wait due to the department being very busy but was treated with care & consideration throughout each procedure. When I was called to see the doctor I was the last patient of her shift. She must have been very tired & ready to go home to bed. She took the time to reassure me, treated me with patience & kindness & explained everything to me.
Going above & beyond. A huge thank you.

author: Karin K
title: Knee replacement surgery
body:
I was admitted for knee replacement surgery last month at Inverclyde hospital Greenock ward K North. This was elective surgery and I have been waiting a long time for this. I have never been to this hospital before (not local to me) and from the minute I walked in the door until I left I was treated with total respect, kindness and care. I had to check at on the ground floor at the A&E reception and the woman checking me in wished me a speedy recovery and was hopeful my operation went well. For sure they were short staffed particularly in the ward but this was not reflective in the care from the nursing, medical and ancillary staff.  
There was a delay in taking me to theatre but once I was down everything went very smoothly. After my surgery was taken back to the ward and given tea and toast which was delicious. I was then able to mobilise with the help of the physiotherapist who was very encouraging. I was discharged less than 24 hours following my surgery and that was due to the great support from the staff.  
A special thank you goes to my surgeon Mr Abu-Rajab and all the staff on ward K North,

title: Staff always trying to help
body: Been a patient for a long time and although hard times for NHS , Temple Fortune been very helpful. Thank you.

title: Absolutely brilliant
body: This  was my second eye op and a brilliant experience from walking in to walking out.  Everone was attentive and professional.  I had the op yesterday (Monday)  and today I can see the raindrops...thank you everone.

title: Very many thanks
body: I contacted the practice in relation to my elderly mother. The person I spoke to was very understanding/helpful and made a telephone appointment with a GP for later that morning. The GP rang as arranged. Again, I was treated in a courteous and helpful way. As a result an urgent referral was made to a dermatologist.  This morning (the day after speaking to the GP) I received the appointment details from the dermatologist, which is in two weeks time. Many thanks to the Bryant Street surgery for all your help

author: Nat7679
title: Very comprehensive appointment
body:
I had a GUM clinic appointment following an ongoing Urinary Tract Infection (UTI).  
I saw Beth & she was absolutely wonderful. Beth was so kind, reassuring, professional & non-judgemental. She made an uncomfortable, anxious experience much more manageable. She kept telling me what was going to happen for each step of the appointment & that helped to keep my anxiety in check. I found Beth very caring & empathic.  
My blood was taken by Keira who was also lovely. I came away with some answers (a confirmed diagnosis of thrush) plus next steps.  
The appointment was also very comprehensive & this was reassuring. I felt my GP was previously just trying to get me off the phone as fast as possible whereas I felt like a person here, not a number.  
I am really grateful. Please pass on my many thanks to Beth & Keira.

title: Much improved reception
body:
I know I’ve complained before but I’d like to say how much the reception have improved in their manner and customer service. They are friendly, empathic and helpful
Keep it up

title: Amazing service
body: I had a great experience with Psicon, such lovely and friendly staff, made myself and my son feel welcome and relaxed. Received an official diagnosis for his Autism within a year without any complicated or confusing procedures, and I always felt informed

title: Fantastic Care
body: Arrived on Sunday for a minor op. The plastic surgeon, the two nurses and the receptionist were very kind and caring. The procedure was carried out professionally and efficiently and in a friendly manner. I am very grateful. Many thanks

title: Great experience
body:
We had a great experience at Queen's Hospital when I had to have an emergency c section. The staff were all so friendly and helpful in making us feel at ease at what was a nerve wracking situation. Everything happened very swiftly and the staff made sure to explain what was happening at each stage too. I was treated well after the operation and a member of staff gave me an extra blanket when I said I was feeling a bit cold. 

Unfortunately, it was a bit noisy in Coral Ward and I didn't sleep that well but the staff were very kind, and helped me look after my newborn.

readBy.name: Barking, Havering and Redbridge University Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Not helpful and could not care.
body: Need an appointment with Glemsford surgery, think again!! Tried making an appointment on two consecutive days at 8:30 in the morning, The woman on the reception phone was, very unhelpful and could not care less about trying to help. All she wanted was to get off the phone as quickly as possible. No wonder are NHS A&E is struggling when the local surgeries, just do want to help. Very disappointing, a waste of time and resource for the community.

author: AmandaJM
title: The care given to my grandad
body:
I would like to pass on my sincere thanks to all at ward 2 Glenrothes hospital for the care and compassion given to my wee grandad at the end of his life.  
Just 4 weeks prior he was healthy living at home independently but unfortunately after breaking his hip he had one thing after another and lost his battle at the beginning of January.  
This was such a difficult time for myself and my family but we were greeted each day by such kind faces and each nurse genuinely couldn’t have done more for us! Each and every one of yous truly are an asset to your team!  
We couldn’t be more thankful to yous! Yous made a horrible time much more bearable! We’ll be forever grateful❤️

author: Karin K
title: Shocked at the care I witnessed
body:
I had recently had knee replacement surgery in another hospital and a week following the surgery I developed complications and had to attended my local A&E.  
Firstly I understand that currently these services are overstretched and I was well aware before my attendance that I would have to wait. What I was not expecting was rude and very uncaring staff, from the reception desk to the nursing staff. I was triaged after an hour and was told I would have to wait about 4 hours to be seen. I sat and waited on the most uncomfortable metal chair ever, in a freezing waiting room for 8 hours, I was alone, in pain and nobody came to check on me but I also did not go to the door to complain, which most other people did on a regular basis.  
When I was taken into the department I was really feeling unwell and my knee was in severe pain, obviously sitting for 8 hours did not help. I asked the nurse who took me in and asked me to get on the trolley if I could have a pillow for under my knee, was told bluntly they don’t have any, and did not offer me anything else. They took bloods and vital signs and left the cubicle, I remained there for 4 hours and they never came back again. After this two doctors came to see me, who were much more caring and understanding and at least apologetic for the circumstances. I was taken for an X-ray and a very kind radiographer did put a pillow under my knee to help relive my pain. I was then transferred by trolley up to ward 23.  
I will again accept that there is a huge demand on services currently and the ward was short staffed, but that is no excuse for some of the behaviour I witnessed by the nursing staff. I will also clarify this is not all the staff but too many were rude, and uncaring to other patients and myself. This is my 3rd admission to hospital in less than 2 years and the other two have been very positive experiences. I have to say this one was not, it was quite horrible, patients who were bed bound were being reprimanded for ringing their buzzers? I could list many examples.  
When I was told the following morning I would have to stay in longer I was devastated and I do not think I could cope with the behaviour I was witnessing. I will point out now that I am a nurse of over 40 years experience and I was shocked at the care I was witnessing. I would say the worst thing that was said to me was that I had, in one nurses option, a low pain threshold. I would like to know how they know and have they any idea how painful a knee is after 7 days post op with complications, as until then I did not?  
Again it was not all negative, myself and fellow patients noted a huge improvement in nursing care when the night staff came on and my consultant who discharged me the following day was fantastic. I really hate to say this as a nurse as my main complaint has to be about the nursing staff not the rest of the team and being short staffed is no excuse ever.

title: Doing well
body:
I have been trying 
for two months  to get a face to face appointment with this specific doctor as I knew my history was familiar to this doctor. 
In the end I managed it with help
and was very happy with the outcome. 
However the two week window for making face to face appointments with a specific doctor  is very frustrating. Every time I rang, aster a very long wait on the telephone. I was told he was fully booked for two weeks and I had to ring back only to get the same response the next time I rang.  The result of this was that I had somewhat  unsuccessful call backs from locum doctors who. In my opinion were not able to deal with my problem satisfactorily as they did not seem to appreciate my full concerns or my problem over the telephone. This was a waste of their time -  and a delay in my treatment. We are asked to see the same doctor whenever possible but this rule about only making appointments two weeks ahead makes this impossible. 
I love this surgery and believe this rule is not of their  making but a general directive. . It needs looking at. 
Blackthorn is a very good surgery with some fantastic doctors doing an impossible job right now. 
I have no complaints about them but they need more support like the whole of the NHS.

title: Surgery is excellent
body: I am a patient, my family is registered. My doctor is very nice, my doctor help solve my problems. I am very happy in the service.

title: Many Thanks
body: Just a quick note to thank all at Bewdley medical. I’m lucky I don’t have to visit the doctors that often however recently I have had to. Getting an appointment was easy and the follow up was prompt. All staff from receptionists, nurses and Doctors’s have been great. Special thanks to my asthma nurse

author: Natbs79
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: The staff have all got a great attitude
body:
I really could not fault the care I have received on the Female Medical Ward. The nurses have been absolutely great and are always there for you when you need them. The staff have all got a great attitude.  
There are always one or two awkward moments but the staff are fantastic on the whole. All their explanations are pretty good but there are a lot of things that just happen without much warning.  
The food has all been fantastic – I was quite surprised given what they say about hospital food.  
Everything has always been kept clean and tidy and the facilities are all good. I have no suggestions for improvement – it has been much better that I have been expecting. It really has been fantastic.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Shirley23
title: Excellent service
body: I went to the Dexa Scan department at the start of January and had a lovely experience. The nurses put me at ease and were lovely and helpful. Excellent service and grateful

title: Fantastically caring MRI team
body: I had to have an MRI scan but I suffer from claustrophobia. The team at KCH couldn't have been more caring and got me through the experience with a smile. They gave me a bit more time than the scheduled appointment to make sure I could tolerate it and all of them (3 individuals in particular come to mind) went way beyond what might have been expected of them. At a time when I know they are under such pressure, I can't begin to explain how incredibly grateful I am. Thank you.

title: Awful practice
body: I have been with this practice for many many years. This surgery does not warrant a 1 star, never ever able to get an appointment, except for a couple of helpful receptionists & nurses, really badly managed. I have now changed to a surgery where they actually see patients, luckily no more remote doctors.

author: Support for nurses
title: 10/10 care - whole department ran like a well oiled machine
body:
Last week I had surgery at the day surgery ward at New Victoria. From the moment I arrived the care I received was second to none. Diane was the nurse that was looking after me while I had my eye operation.  
As a man I was kidding on I was fine but to be honest I was terrified and Diane was amazing. Diane had the patter, she was reassuring and knowledgeable. I watched as she looked after the 5 of us that were waiting for our operations and the care she showed to each and everyone of us to make sure we were all comfortable listening to us and seemed really interested in what we had to say and any concerns we had.  
The whole department ran like a well oiled machine from the receptionist through to the operating team all were professional kind and experienced. Sorry I can’t remember all your names.  
The NHS is taking a battering right now and we the public need to fight for the future of our NHS. We need to highlight more and more all the excellent work that they do on a daily basis. Does it need fixing, of course it does but there are amazing people who work there that all they want to do is care for people the best they can, and sadly are in a position that they can’t offer the care they want.

title: All Good
body:
Appointment arranged at v short notice
Dr was very meticulous and thorough as well as having a friendly manner
The follow ups have happened very quickly
All on all a good and comforting experience

title: Excellent efficient service from the team
body:
I am writing on behalf of husband and I to thank you for the efficient, thoughtful and skilled way you took care of my 98 year old  mother in law on 20th December. She had been taken seriously ill after coming to stay with us for Christmas from her home in Manchester. Your team in particular the receptionist,  got her an appointment that day, registered her as temporary patient, advised us how to sort out her medication and helped us stay calm when we were very worried. The GP was very gentle and skilled and quickly took tests and told us to go to A and E . We were astonished that the results and a letter from the GP were at the QE before we were, meaning she was seen and received the right treatment quickly and with less fuss.
After two weeks in hospital my mother in law is now back to her usual self and back home.
We have been patients of your surgery for over 30 years and have always been very grateful for your skill but especially over this issue at a time when we know how stretched you all are.

Many thanks again.

Helen Jones.

author: Parrot
title: Helped and looked after
body:
I would like to thank Susan, Stuart, Gwen and all their staff at day surgery for their help after my surgery. They were very helpful and looked after their patients well Also to the doctors and the anaesthetist, thanks again.  
[Unsure about 'Nurses']  
  
[Unsure about 'Care staff']  
  
[Unsure about 'Doctor']

title: impossible to get an appointment
body: impossible to get an appointment, told to keep trying spending hours each day to be told no regular appointments available , no one can tell me when the best time to call would be to get a regular appointment apparently it a lottery now whether you receive the health care they proport to provide. do they not realise that not providing regular appointments mean that minor problems end up not being addressed and manifest bigger and more serious health problems

title: Very good care from the staff at Airedale…
body: I spent a few days over Christmas in Airedale hospital with pneumonia. The care and treatment I received was outstanding. The staff were obviously under pressure due to the hospital been so busy but they still delivered a first class service and with a smile! Thank you!

author: Caref93
title: Too many patients, too few staff
body:
Referred by the GP. The wait was over 4 hours which was fine for me, carer, but hard for the patient in their eighties. The first consultation was held in a visitors room as there was no room inside. Eventually he was admitted and had to sit upright in a chair in front of nurses station. Several people were in the same position. It was nearer 10-11 pm before a bed was found and situated in corridor between two other beds.  
The care was good which is surprising under the circumstances.  
Too many patients, too few staff. A disgrace in my view.

author: In so much pain
title: Medical practice phone system
body:
I have been trying to call my GP practice in Dunfermline for 3 days now. Each time I am held in a queue (usually starting at “you are number 15 in the queue”) I wait for around 40 minutes and then when I get to number 1 it just rings out without anyone answering the phone.  
I have been in so much pain and unable to get to the surgery so really not sure what else to do but it makes me very worried about anyone who is more vulnerable.  
Last month I had to phone a separate number for a prescription and it was an answering machine but the prescription wasn’t put to the chemist until 6 days later, by which point I had run out of stock. I find the reception staff are usually very rude once you do get through but this time round I am really worried as I feel so ill and am in so much pain and no one is answering.

author: whiskeybd99
title: Parking - I feel this should be available for service users
body:
I appreciate that employees want easy parking when they go to work but I constantly see the same cars in the car park which means that service users have to find space on the random roads around the building.  
Appointments are generally stressful enough without having to worry about parking. There is very limited parking at the front of Northlands and I feel this should be available for service users and not used by staff.  
I have visited at various different times/days and the cars are the same. Due to Northlands being on a hill, it is also dangerous when you have to reverse out of the car park due to all the spaces being taken.

readBy.name: Sheffield Health and Social Care NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great care
body: Having to go to department late on Saturday I was concerned at what I might find. I need not have worried.  The care I received was brilliant, staff were kind and reassuring, the atmosphere was calm and controlled.  I cannot thank all the staff highly enough for the way I was treated and my issue resolved.

author: Plewliz
title: Understanding and kindness
body: I was an outpatient on ward 1B at Pilgrims Hospital Boston and was very nervous due to a previous experiences elsewhere. I was listened to and Sister Palmer was so understanding, kind and gentle. I had a procedure done and couldn't have done it without her encouragement and empathy. The two nurses who helped with the procedure, Tracy and Anita, were also lovely and took my mind off it. They are a credit to the profession and real angels.

title: Great Practice and Staff
body: I know that GP surgeries are struggling at the minute and there are alot of people complaining, however, I can't fault Kirkheaton Surgery at all. I have had to go a few times over the past six months and I have got in the same day I called. The reception staff have been lovely and the doctors have been great in resolving my issues. I saw a lovely doctor this morning who was so helpful and gave me the time to explain my problem, I didn't feel rushed and he put my mind at ease. I obviously appreciate that they are extremely busy at the minute so will only go if I really need to and I try not to take up too much of their time. I just want to say a massive thank you to all the reception staff and doctors who are doing a fantastic job at Kirkheaton Surgery

title: Excellent practice, the Best of all
body: They gave the best service, the doctors did the best, their services were splendid, the nurse as well was so gracious, the staffs were the best. Highly recommend

author: learningpm45
title: Lack of compassion and increase anxiety
body:
I phoned NHS24 due to testing positive for Covid, being Immuno-compromised and also 9 weeks pregnant. NHS24 was extremely busy and was on hold for 2 hours before I spoke to a call handler, who was very understanding of my call and spoke to the nurse at NHS24, who advised that they would like a Dr to phone me back due to symptoms and current situation.  
A doctor phoned me back. They were very understanding and showed compassion towards my situation, which was a very stressful time due to covid, Immuno-compromised and also 9 weeks pregnant. Due to the symptoms I was experiencing, this doctor wanted me to speak to a consultant from the covid department and ensure antiviral treatments were safe during pregnancy. They asked me to call the Hub in the morning due to public holiday and time this evening.  
The doctor phoned me again to see how I was, and to ask if I had spoken to consultant yet. I can’t thank this doctor enough for how they dealt with this situation and care and compassion showed towards me at such a stressful time. A Dr from Covid helpline called me back. They didn’t realise I was pregnant as they were going through a questionnaire for antiviral medication. I was advised that treatment was very different when pregnant. Dr asked me how I knew I was pregnant, which I advised I had taken a early pregnancy test and was nearly 9 weeks pregnant at this point. Dr advised that they were going to speak to an obstetrician and phoned me back.When this Dr from the Covid helpline phoned me back they were then talking about how things can naturally terminate, and also asked me if I could go and take a pregnancy test to see if it’s positive or negative, as if it’s negative they would be able to prescribe antiviral medications. I explained that I was definitely pregnant as I had been for a private scan as well to prove this. I said to this Dr that I am sorry to interrupt but I hope I am still pregnant, to which the Dr said they congratulate me on this.The obstetrician referred me to have a scan to validate my pregnancy. Due to speaking to this consultant, I was very nervous after conversation. I was told this day that I was having a silent miscarriage and lost my baby 3 weeks ago. I found the Dr from the covid line to be very inappropriate saying statements in this sense when a women is very early pregnant and is aware that miscarriage happens but to add additional stress on when already having a stressful and upsetting time and panicking because of current situation. I don’t feel like this was dealt with appropriately and after phone call with this Dr, I was upset and annoyed. I felt like I had to tell my story so this Dr acknowledges how they dealt with my situation and doesn’t cause other pregnant women to worry and anxiety that is unnecessary.

links.id: nhs111 in dealing with my call

title: Excellent care
body: I attended Boothroyd Day Centre to have a lump removed under general anaesthetic. From walking through the door to leave my experience was brilliant. The receptionist was great, the staff nurse was very friendly, professional and clear on what would happen. The surgeon was very quick but precise when he saw me prior to theatre. The care of the nurses in recovery was second to none. They were regular asking if I was ok, provided me a little water and checked a felt well, drink and toast and again check I was feeling ok. It was a really slick process provided by caring staff. Just want to say a massive thank you to the team for what they did and how they made me feel. They are a fantastic people who are very good at what they do.
